name: glycoprotein
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of protein molecule that has a carbohydrate group attached to the amino acid chain: Many viruses have glycoproteins that help them enter bodily cells. Chemically, the plasma membrane consists of glycoprotein.
More examplesFewer examplesA glycoprotein identified in the Antarctic cod and other fish of the southern oceans acts as a kind of natural "antifreeze", preventing ice crystals from forming in the blood.Cartilage oligomeric matrix protein (COMP) is a glycoprotein found in cartilage, tendon, ligament and muscle.The decrease in virus replication was related to a decrease in glycoprotein B, which is crucial for the release and infectivity of the virus.CRP is an abnormal serum glycoprotein produced by the liver during acute inflammation.The virus insinuates itself into its victims' bloodstreams by using a glycoprotein (a protein with sugars attached to it) to disable the host's immune response.
